text:
This is a movie review for the film "Return to Dust," which tells the story of two marginalized and lonely individuals in rural China - an ironsmith named Youxiang with his wife Ma, and Cao Guying, who is physically disabled and unable to reproduce. Despite their hardships, they strive to find happiness by working together and improving their living conditions through farming, raising animals, building houses, and cultivating land. The film has received critical acclaim, including being nominated for the Golden Bear Award at the Berlin International Film Festival. Here are some download links for the movie:
